Full documentation <https://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/expand> or available locally via: info '(coreutils) expand invocation'
DESCRIPTION: Convert tabs in each FILE to spaces, writing to standard output.
With no FILE, or when FILE is -, read standard input.
Mandatory arguments to long options are mandatory for short options too.
-i, --initial do not convert tabs after non blanks
-t, --tabs=N have tabs N characters apart, not 8

-t, --tabs=LIST use  comma  separated  list  of tab positions The last specified position can be prefixed with '/' to specify a tab size to use after the last explicitly specified tab stop.  Also a prefix of '+' can  be used to align remaining tab stops relative to the last specified tab stop instead of the first column
NAME: expand - convert tabs to spaces
